metadata.title: CVE-2017-7189 php: misparsing fsockopen calls in main/streams/xp_socket.c leads to information disclosure (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: main/streams/xp_socket.c in PHP 7.x before 2017-03-07 misparses fsockopen calls, such as by interpreting fsockopen('127.0.0.1:80', 443) as if the address/port were 127.0.0.1:80:443, which is later truncated to 127.0.0.1:80. This behavior has a security risk if the explicitly provided port number (i.e., 443 in this example) is hardcoded into an application as a security policy, but the hostname argument (i.e., 127.0.0.1:80 in this example) is obtained from untrusted input. 
            STATEMENT: This issue affects the php version as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7, 8 and it was rated as having a security impact of 'Moderate'. It also affects the versions rh-php71-php, rh-php70-php, rh-php72-php distributed with Red Hat Software Collection 3.
